intro: Thapsia nitida subsp. nitida, commonly known as the slender thapsia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and compound umbels of small white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has slender, branched stems with finely divided leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The subspecies is distinguished by its smaller size and more delicate appearance compared to other Thapsia species.
